longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to make provision as regards the pensions of certain officers transferred from service under the Government to the service of the Vocational Training Council.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Pensions (Special Provisions) (Vocational Training Council) Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.content: In this Ordinance the Council (訓練局) means the Vocational Training Council.

subsection.leadIn: This Ordinance applies to any officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is transferred from service under the Government to service under the Council; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who was, immediately before the transfer, an officer to whom the Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89) or the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) applied; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whose transfer to such service is specified for the purposes of this section by the Chief Executive by notice in the Gazette. (Amended 63 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.content: A notice referred to in subsection (1) shall specify the day on which the transfer to which it relates occurred or, where appropriate, is to occur.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application of Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89) and Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) extended

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an officer is transferred to service under the Council; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the officer is an officer to whom this Ordinance applies; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: immediately before the transfer he was an officer to whom the Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89) applied,

subsection.continued: whatever the date on which the relevant notice under section 3(1) is published, for so long as he is in the service of the Council that Ordinance shall continue to apply to him and, accordingly, any such service rendered by him shall for the purposes of this subsection be regarded as being pensionable service within the meaning of that Ordinance or, in case immediately before such transfer, the officer was rendering service which could be taken into account in computing an allowance under that Ordinance, his service under the Council shall for such purposes be regarded as being service which may be so taken into account.
